thread.title: Former Liverpool and Arsenal star Jermaine Pennant joins League One Bury after pay dispute with Singaporean side Tampines Rovers
thread.title_full: Former Liverpool and Arsenal star Jermaine Pennant joins League One Bury after pay dispute with Singaporean side Tampines Rovers

author: mheathsmith
title: Former Liverpool and Arsenal star Jermaine Pennant joins League One Bury after pay dispute with Singaporean side Tampines Rovers
text:
Comments JERMAINE PENNANT has joined League One Bury – after his pay dispute with Singaporean side Tampines Rovers. 
The ex- Liverpool and Arsenal winger has signed a deal until the end of the season at Gigg Lane. Action Images Jermaine Pennant last played in England for Wigan in 2015 
Pennant, 34, has been training with the Shakers in recent weeks after leaving S-League side. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest EFL news, gossip and transfers 
He left Tampines in November following a clash over his “super-scale” salary. 
Pennant refused to accept a reduction in his £23,495-a-month wage when the club when the club fell into financial difficulties. Getty Images Pennant left Singaporean side Tampines Rovers after refusing to take pay cut PA:Press Association 4 Pennant has had spells with Arsenal, Liverpool, Birmingham, Leeds and Stoke in Premier League 
Club chairman Krishna Ramachandra said it would “create a social injustice” to carry on paying the former England U21 international his inflated salary while his team-mates took a pay cut. 
Rovers finished second, one point behind Albirex Niigata, during Pennant’s season with the club. 
Pennant, who once “forgot” he owned a Porsche during his spell with Spanish side Real Zaragoza, will wear the number 38 shirt at Bury. — Bury Football Club (@buryfcofficial) January 19, 2017 
He will not be available for Friday’s clash with Port Vale as the move has not yet received international clearance. 
Bury sit 20 th in League One, out of the relegation places on goal difference. 
Pennant has made 273 league appearances in England, scoring 18 goals. Pennant's Ferarri exhaust clanger
